website_summaries.verdict: An affordable set of studio quality headphones that are great for casual listening.
pros: Balanced frequency delivery when playing most types of music
cons: Replaceable cord is prone to damage if left out in the open on the floor

customer_reviews.title: Completely neutral goodness.
customer_reviews.text: Listen, I love bass and that's why I also own v-moda crossfire shadow m-100's for casual listening. 702's are for critical listening with certain types of music. It's for when you need absolutely flat sound and aren't in it for bass. They are excellent in what they are built to do. But don't think these are party music headphones. Get the m-100's for that. 702s are great set of headphones if you know what you are looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Young

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: First impression is that it looks a little "plasticy" and cheap. But, as soon as I plugged them into my receiver, I was amazed at how detailed they sounded. And by the clear bass that they put out. Shocked and amazed! I immediately put my Koss cans on my bookshelf to collect dust.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly

customer_reviews.title: 🤬
customer_reviews.text: I always thought that AKG was an Australian company, I received my pair and let me say the lack luster unboxing experience is devastating. I would imagine $200 would feel dedicated to the craftsmanship. The headband says made in china, not sure if its real leather. I have the audio Techs mx50 which are solid. I also have a pair of the Adx 500s which feel cheap. Literally no metal on these, I hope to the creators put all the money in the internals. Feel like I should have got the beyerdynamic 990pros instead
customer_reviews.author: Kyle quinn bustoz

customer_reviews.title: Just awful
customer_reviews.text: Awful headphones. Cheap, Chinese build. The ear pads felt like something you'd find on a dollar store headphone. Material flimsy, and no clamping force. The sound quality was just ok. The soundstage was barely there. Unimpressed, have had better "gaming headsets" than these headphones. Overall disappointed in the quality of AKG product. Will probably never buy another one.
customer_reviews.author: SlimCognito

customer_reviews.title: No bass, cheap feeling build quality.
customer_reviews.text: (Reviewing the K712 Pro). I was unimpressed by these headphones as a music listener. They have severe bass roll off so they alter the intention of EDM and rock music. They're great if you're trying to pick apart vocals and separation but I couldn't tolerate them sucking any fun out of listening. I've read that these are more "bassy" than the 701/702...and my response is "just how awful are those then if even the 712 has nothing?" Also the build quality is very mediocre. It's pretty much the same as their low end <$100 models with a lot of plastic. On the plus side all the plastic makes them very lightweight.
customer_reviews.author: Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Tremendous sound
customer_reviews.text: I have listened to The Nutcracker Suite, Adigo, Rock, from The Who to Aerosmith, to The Eagles, these headphones are top notch. I am 64 years old, have some hearing loss, but wear hearing aids. I paired these headphones with Ear Studio, ES 100 Bluetooth reciever. This allows you to adjust the output that the headphones recieves. It also allows you to plug headphones into it and stream the music from your music device you are using, I Phone works great! They are worth $100, to be wireless.
customer_reviews.author: Cyber One

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy from Homegoods Shop. Refund hard to get.
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy from Homegoods Shop. Refund hard to get. Headphones review - 4 stars I owned 'Audio-Technica ATH-M50x Professional Headphones' for 3 years and thought I had one of the top qualities headsets AKG Pro Audio K712 proved the opposite is just a different level altogether (price range too 2x pretty much), wonderful headsets with the top-notch sound quality it takes couple songs to get your brain to develop new high-quality taste. I didn't like as much velour ear cups is a little warm wearing these for me personally.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely the best gaming headphones
customer_reviews.text: Amazing headphones! Footsteps, enemy location and the imaging and how accurate there are are truly amazing No other headphones comes close to how good these are for “Gaming”. If you looking for “AudioPhile” headphones for gaming These are King, yes better then the AD700x AD900x AD1000x.
customer_reviews.author: Joel

customer_reviews.title: good sound is hard to convey...
customer_reviews.text: This is almost too advanced of a product for me to give you my full review. Once you have an amp that can power them, they are amazing. I did a lot of work to my setup and i’m so very happy with the sound. Lots of range, a bit “flat” but overall so great for games, so lightweight, easy breathing.... I replaced some “Cloud HyperX II” with these. not the same category but these AKG 712 PRO really showed a next level to the already great clouds.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The Cadillac of headphones.
customer_reviews.text: I've gone through 7 other pairs of headphones from reputable brands in as many years of ownership of these AKGs which remain as a top performer in all aspects minus portability; although comfortable, they're extremely large. Forget about Beats and Bose--these headphones easily outshine them in fidelity. If you're even a little bit of an audiophile, the 702's are the best investment you can make...if you can still find them on the market.
customer_reviews.author: AllanLav

customer_reviews.title: Must have headset
customer_reviews.text: Okay, listen to me. Stop buying “gaming” headsets and buy this with a mod mic! The sound is 100x better and more comfortable. I use it for music and gaming. Edit: Almost 2 years later, the headset still works as new. Daily driver ever since and hasn't given me any problems. Highly recommend it. I've removed the modmic and switched to a mic on a boom. Looks nicer too and the headset is a little lighter.
customer_reviews.author: TK

customer_reviews.title: Wow
customer_reviews.text: The most comfortable and neutral pair I have ever owned. I have headphones ranging from Sennheisers to Koss Electrostats and for the price these are amazing. No harshness like the DT990's, for example. I LOVE how comfortable these things are. They are hard to drive though, so you wont get anything past "OK" volume from say a portable device or similar. The stats are better overall of course but they cost in the 1K range. I have mine pushed by a HK3490 (Which uses its mains for the output) and couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Henyaman

customer_reviews.title: The best in comfort, excellent in sound.
customer_reviews.text: I have never had such comfortable headphones in my life, they sound absolutely amazing. I have never whole heartedly fully pushed for people to buy something before, but these are a must have set. They are great for their main purpose in music and zreviews on yt does a great job explaining them. But they are also great at gaming as long as you understand that they are open backed.
customer_reviews.author: Austin

customer_reviews.title: Serious Bang for the Buck
customer_reviews.text: I've tried quite a few headphones now in all different price ranges and have to say that these AKG Pro Audio K712 PRO headphones are better sounding than many of the more expensive headphones. These are really a triple threat with music and amazing for Gaming and Movies/TV listening. Definitely the best gaming headphone I've ever heard by a pretty big margin. Best headphones in the $300-$350 price range that I've heard and now own... are the K712 and the Hifiman Sundara.
customer_reviews.author: Bob A. Booey

customer_reviews.title: Super detailed!
customer_reviews.text: I'm hearing details in music I've never heard before! Whether listening to my own material in my home studio, SACDs, Blu-ray audio discs, DVD-A or even high bit rate MP3s, these headphones deliver! They do require a decent amount of power to drive, but my phone and tablet are able to get a decent volume - just not ear-bleed level. Don't expect over-hyped bass, that's not what these headphones are about. You hear every note of the bass, but for pleasure listening through my Yamaha receiver I did turn up the bass tone control about 3db. Extremely immersive soundstage!
customer_reviews.author: TooManyGuitars

customer_reviews.title: Neutral and accurate headphones perfect for your home studio
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are known for their accuracy: what the recording engineer meant you to hear is what you should hear. If a track has accentuated bass, you should hear accentuated bass. If a track is filled with nuances, you should hear the nuances. In my experience, the AKGs deliver exactly that. I bought them for my home studio mainly for mixing the tracks I compose and record, and they have been superlative for that purpose. The only reason I rated them four instead of five stars is their comfort level. After three or four hours in the studio, I’ve noticed that the earpieces impart noticeable pressure, not painful but slightly annoying. Not a show-stopper by any means, but worth noting.
customer_reviews.author: James A. Cahill

customer_reviews.title: Not worth their weight in any currency.
customer_reviews.text: I understand perfectly that these are reference headphones, but damn even with a DAC/AMP the low end on these are pathetic! Skip these and stick with Beyerdynamic, who actually make cans worth the price. What a waste of $200.
customer_reviews.author: P. C. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Get you a pair
customer_reviews.text: Awesome. They are very neutral, damn good for mixing and mastering. The sound is spacious, clean and clear, small concert style sound. Detailed, I can hear every thing recorded masterfully, all your mess ups will be heard so you can mix better. For reference heaphones these are a steal at the price. Easily contend with higher priced hp.
customer_reviews.author: Clinton Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Flat response is excellent for gaming (my main purpose for picking these up).
customer_reviews.text: My new go to for gaming. Very comfortable and excellent sound signature. Retired my DT 990 Pro's to the music only headphone shelf. Stock pads are comfortable and headband with auto adjustment is spot on. More bass than the Audio Technica ATH-AD700X's but not so present that you cannot hear other in game sounds, like my DT 990's were presenting. Only gripe would be the non-detachable cable but that was quickly remedied with a couple of strategically placed zip ties.
customer_reviews.author: HarrisR

customer_reviews.title: Pricey, plastic, and absolutely fantastic.
customer_reviews.text: Though the headphones themselves were quite pricey at the time of my purchase, I can say that they are amazing to listen to. I've been using them for gaming, despite some recommending against it. Though the audio is shart due to the studio reference nature of these headphones, with a bit of EQing I've found them to be the best pair of headphones I've ever used in terms of audio locating things such as footsteps for those into more competitive games. Music sounds absolutely fantastic with them as well. A note: I am using a usb DAC.
customer_reviews.author: William A.

customer_reviews.title: Very goooodddd
customer_reviews.text: Yea these things are wonderful. I had other headphones and they were nowhere as good as thse for gaming. I had v Moda m100 and hd 650s. Can hear footsteps a lot better with good location. Wonderful. Really recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Daozer562

customer_reviews.title: Lots of bass if you can drive it right.
customer_reviews.text: Syas 200mw max input but they'll take a lot more. These things pump serious bazs if you can eq it. With daisy chained fully perametric equalizers in front of line amps and behind some high end opamps I can get very heavy bass and it sounds excellent. Normaly line level would be around 200mw, eq line level runs multiple volts. I've ran these at 16 volts peak to peak - 3 volts RMS! (Measured with an oscilloscope) They ran just fine and sounded like I was up front at a concert. Wonderful cans.
customer_reviews.author: west

customer_reviews.title: I have pretty big ears, and needs to not pinch my earlobes or the tops of my ears during use. The detachable cable is a good ide
customer_reviews.text: So far so good, I use them for mixing down tracks in Apple logic studio and they are a big help. I also use an old set of NS 10 Yamaha speakers As a reference, but the speakers and the phones work well together. It's a particular help with low-end, because my home studio has no acoustic treatment to balance out weird residence in that frequency. Quite comfortable too, even after long periods. I have pretty big ears, and needs to not pinch my earlobes or the tops of my ears during use. The detachable cable is a good idea. If someone yanks on it it just comes out instead of destroying the headphones.
customer_reviews.author: 30 Weight

customer_reviews.title: Great sound stage
customer_reviews.text: I was impressed with the range of the soundstage in these cans. I'm noticing things in my favorite songs that I never heard before. Also, they are extremely comfortable. The only complaint anyone has against these cans is that they are light on bass. To me, the bass sounds natural. Don't let this be the reason you pass on these great headphones. For reference, I'm listening to these with a Magni 3 and Modi 3.
customer_reviews.author: James W.

customer_reviews.title: Sound is great
customer_reviews.text: I got these after running Audio-Technica ATH-AD 500Xs for a few years. Definitely a step up in comfort and sound quality, although I'm not sure by how much. I use a FiiO E10k AMP-DAC and need to use the high-gain setting with around 4-7 volume to feel confident while gaming. Detachable cable is great, though the ear pad/headband clamp is actually pretty strong which is uncomfortable. Not sure I would buy again, given the price -- especially if the 500Xs came with a detachable cable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for mixing, mastering, and producing !
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are comfortable for long sessions and have a great flat response for mixing on the road or in the studio. I use them to mix and produce in the late night hours . My results have been just as good if I were using my Yamaha HS8 monitors .
customer_reviews.author: Marcus Harvey

customer_reviews.title: Awesome headphones with someone design flaws
customer_reviews.text: This is my second unit, the sounds are great but there some issue with its design. First the cable,. Somehow it feels cheap and my first unit already has resoldered both ends cause by faulty contacts. Second the transparent hoster or clip has two thin strips caused by the cut hole. Those are the first thing to break. It should be made of metal. I'm not asking for high quality aluminium just plain metal should suffice. This I think is a greave material error in design. And lastly the price. You can get this awesome headphones, they do sounds amazing, from usd400 and as little as usd180 wth?
customer_reviews.author: yihong

customer_reviews.title: Made in China but who cares
customer_reviews.text: I've used akg k240 for the better of 15 years and I got these finally to do more precise analysis and help with mixing and mastering. They are made in China now unlike my k240 and I suspect they won't hold up as long but as far as the sound goes they're pretty spot on. Not too harsh, the bass is there but not overwhelming. Very honest and pretty flat response which is what I needed. Not bad for the price just be careful with them.
customer_reviews.author: Yung Rap

customer_reviews.title: Great sound poor materials
customer_reviews.text: Headphones sound amazing, (highly recommended to pair this with an amp/dac) The materials used, however, feel very cheap, primarily the two black bands that go across the top of the headphones. They are made of plastic and feel like they could break easily if not handled with care. The suspension system also worries me as it seems to use a thin elastic string. Earcups feel soft and comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Renaldo

customer_reviews.title: Letdown for a big name product
customer_reviews.text: A little disappointed in the product due to the right headphone speaker not working with any plug in, and no 3.5mm adapter was in the box when I got to open the headsets. Furthermore, this was a gift for my birthday so it wasn't given to me until 2 days before the end of the return window so now I can *hopefully* be granted an exception due to a faulty product.
customer_reviews.author: BeltBoy90

customer_reviews.title: Harsh when loud... otherwise sound great!
customer_reviews.text: Can't put my finger on it, but these sound harsh when cranked up, even with an amp. (I didn't try them without an amp.) Otherwise, they have a nice sound to them. Warm, but not bass heavy or booming. Mids are nice. Highs are good, slightly sibilant to me. Previously had ATHAD-700X's. These are a more balanced sounding headphone. I didn't like how stiff the leather in the headband was. (Made in Slovakia, if that matters.) (I sent the pair that I bought back because the condition was not as described.) Sound is highly subjective... just buy them and try them!
customer_reviews.author: Analog

customer_reviews.title: I use them with a Schiit Lyr 2 and that amp has really brings out good, tight bass response
customer_reviews.text: I bought the AKG K712 cans because I felt I was wearing out my HD 650s. They are a little more detailed than the HD650 and perform extremely well on Jazz. I use them with a Schiit Lyr 2 and that amp really brings out good, tight bass response. Great value!
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence Poellnitz

customer_reviews.title: Wow, what a difference
customer_reviews.text: I've been using AKG 240 Studio headphones at work for nearly 15 years. I like the sound. I got these K612PRO to replace a pair I use at home. The lows are cleaner and stronger and the highs are transparent. AND the pads on the ears and the headband are much more comfortable. These are great headphones and for the money can't be beat.
customer_reviews.author: Kael Blackwood

customer_reviews.title: Amazing headphones
customer_reviews.text: The imaging on these headphones make them one of the best pair of headphones you will ever use for Competitive FPS gaming. Amp/dac is recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Jimbo

customer_reviews.title: The way music is supposed to sound.
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely amazing. WAY beyond expectations! Don't think to hard about getting these, just 1-click buy now and enjoy what music is supposed to sound like. Only caveat; you'll probably want to get a headphone amp of some sort. I picked up the magni 3/modi 2 uber schiit stack and couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: teddymac

customer_reviews.title: Very good for work, Not play.
customer_reviews.text: If you like anything with bass, Don't get these. If you like anything with explosions, Don't get these. If you like top clarity vocals, Get these. If you like Jazz, Get these. Basically, Very good for say, Recording, at neutral sound stages, but not for entertainment.
customer_reviews.author: William Harrison AKA Eblis

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic headphones & excellent Amazon customer service
customer_reviews.text: I received this headphones today. I put on the headphones and listened to some 24/96 files from my Mac Book Pro and I can't put it down. The music is thoroughly enjoyable. There is more than enough bass for me. I listen to all kinds of music, from jazz to rock and to classical. All music sounds good with this headphones, especially when the recording is good. The headphones cup is bigger than I expected, but it is comfortable enough. Music music here I come. ----- I had some issues with packaging. Amazon customer service resolved all my issues with their normal professionalism promptly and efficiently.
customer_reviews.author: F. Wong

customer_reviews.title: No volume
customer_reviews.text: They won't go Loud enough. My ears don't get as hot as when using the cheaper ones so there's that.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: The single greatest pair I've ever used.
customer_reviews.text: From the build quality alone these might be the best, but they are insanely comfortable and have hands down the best audio quality I've ever heard. From listening to music to video games I've never been more impressed. Escape from Tarkov is so much better now ;) If they are in your budget they will absolutely blow lower classes headphones out of the water. I'm extremely pleased and can't recommend them enough. I've never heard such a level of detail in headphones before.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Sarles

customer_reviews.title: K702 Made in China
customer_reviews.text: All previous reviewers detail the audio quality and soundstage perfectly. Great sound but needs lots of power to brighten. Bass is a bit underwhelming. Biggest flaw: the ear pads, stiff and don’t conform to your facial structure. The K702 are now made in China.
customer_reviews.author: Life In Motion

customer_reviews.title: To fully enjoy this, break in maybe needed
customer_reviews.text: I have Sennheiser HD600, Shure 1540, V Moda 100. & Sony A1. Bass is a bit heavier than Senn HD600, and produces a bit darker sound. It does not mean its mid & treble are dimmed. To fully enjoy this, break in maybe needed. It feels it sounds somewhat similar to Senn HD650 that I traded for HD600. Comfort is good, but not as comfy as my Sony. Oh, mine was made in Slovakia, not Austria.
customer_reviews.author: Kenji

customer_reviews.title: Great cans.
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded from the K240's to these and they are great. It takes some time to get used to the stereo field due them being open but overall these are a really good upgrade from the K240. I think a perfect studio solution is to have both tbh. The build quality is solid and the sound quality is good. They're a bit higher on the impedance than the 240 so you will notice a drop is gain but paired with a good amp, you should be good.
customer_reviews.author: christopher39

customer_reviews.title: Broken after 6 months
customer_reviews.text: I loved these headphones. Good sound quality and very comfortable. But the left side stopped working after about 6 months. I tried contacting customer service because 6 months still falls under warranty, but I got no response. 1 star for bad overall quality and terrible customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: I'm happy. A review
customer_reviews.text: I'm happy. A review? Most people don't understand what things should really sound like. If you want to hate the recordings of most modern music, and hear what the masters made years ago, these are great. If you listen to modern music on these you will hear the distortion and it will hurt your ears.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for mixing high-end
customer_reviews.text: I bought these as a tertiary source for mixing music. Super-clear sound! Very detailed midi and highs. Wish they had about 1 or 2 db more lows from 125Hz and under. I can't rely on them for low frequencies but great for stereo spectrum choices and checking "s" in vocals. Also great for deciding info from 8k and up.
customer_reviews.author: NikNo

customer_reviews.title: Great, comfortable and sounded wonderful
customer_reviews.text: I had the AKG K270 Studio headphones for 10 years. Great, comfortable and sounded wonderful. Very faithful and reliable. Then one channel went out. I thought it was the cable, but alas, it was in the phones which are nigh to impossible to open up without permanent damage. I ordered as a replacement the AKG Pro Audio K702 headphones. I assumed they would feel and sound the same. Conclusion: awesome, beautiful, clear sound. I can't believe how much warmer they are with a clear sense of presence. They are very comfortable, with cloth cushions, good for my big head and larger ears. I could not be more please with these great headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Phil Hooper

customer_reviews.title: They're good, but I'd upgrade
customer_reviews.text: I enjoyed these headphones a lot. They're very detailed and sound really good, and they're great for playing games with large soundstages. However, in my opinion, they're too lacking in the low-end. I bought K712s instead, and I like those MUCH MUCH more. I'd highly recommend getting those over these. Find a nice used pair for the same price. But if you still want these, they're quite good.
customer_reviews.author: Austin Schultz

customer_reviews.title: impossible not to get broken
customer_reviews.text: They sound awesome. But they stopped working within a 2 - 3 months. The weldings of the cables internally are too soft, and I had to take them to an expert in order to fix them and redo the weldings.... PD: They were treated very carefully all the time...
customer_reviews.author: Manuel Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Superb sound
customer_reviews.text: To be honest, I didn't think that I could find such a good sound at this price point. The materials are not premium to my taste, you are paying for high end sound at mid-price and some sacrifice has to be made. The self-adjusting feature didn't work for me, which was both unusual and sorrowful.
customer_reviews.author: Edmund A

customer_reviews.title: garbage seller
customer_reviews.text: Head phones im sure are decent, the seller on the other hand is pretty trash. I only had them a month and they are already broken. The seller just pushed me to the mfr warranty rather than try and help fix the issue because "the return window has expired". That's honestly disgusting because I have literally had them a month. From delivery to broken.
customer_reviews.author: sean

customer_reviews.title: Good for gaming but comfort can be hit or miss
customer_reviews.text: These headphones sound very tinny to me. The soundstage is extremely wide. Almost to wide. They are not comfortable at all. The band across the top doesn’t feel well and the pads with shallow ear cups leave a lot to be desired.
customer_reviews.author: Edward

customer_reviews.title: They're comfortable, well-engineered
customer_reviews.text: These are exceptional headphones, reproducing high-quality audio the way it should be, unfettered by "enhanced bass" and anomalies in frequency response. They're comfortable, well-engineered, and produce extraordinary sound. The only down-side might be their lack of sensitivity; it does take more "juice" to drive these headphones which would not make them a good choice for portable music players. But, then again, MP3 files are anything but high-quality audio, so it's probably a moot point. If you're looking for headphones designed to reproduce audio the way it was intended, the K702 is hard to beat without having to spend a great deal more money.
customer_reviews.author: B. Browning

customer_reviews.title: These have very good treble and decent sound stage
customer_reviews.text: These have very good treble and decent sound stage, but out of my 9 headphones, I use these the least. I’m not really a treble guy but these headphones helped me appreciate treble a little more. Powering them with Fostex HPA4-BL / Asus Essence Stx-ii / Aune X1S / soundblaster zxr. For some reason the sound the best on my least favorite amp, the soundblaster.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph S.

customer_reviews.title: This is one of the best products I have purchased in a while
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best products I have purchased in a while. I use these headphones to creat presets on my line 6 Helix and when I show up rehearsals, I'm getting the same sound through the house I was hoping for when listening through the headphones. I also use them when writing and recording when I need to keep the noise down at night. If you are in the market for some high end reference headphones then you can't go wrong with these.
customer_reviews.author: Blevin R.

customer_reviews.title: This comfort was a huge score as I like o stay glued to my MacBook when I'm mixing
customer_reviews.text: The sound was sonically dry, my preference. Light and comfy. This comfort was a huge score as I like o stay glued to my MacBook when I'm mixing. I can go for hours at a time. My previous headphones were ATH-M50. Those just squished up against my head and caused a lot pain on the back side of my head. Used for studio mixing, and K702 delivers all the qualities needed. Happy
customer_reviews.author: sonny

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, lacking comfort
customer_reviews.text: These headphones sound great, as they should for the price. The sound profile feels very neutral. Highs and mids are crisp and low notes resonate but remain clear. My only complaint has to do with the self-adjusting headband. While these headphones aren't at all heavy, there presence is persistent. It is just enough to become annoying when in use for multiple hours. I personally prefer the feel of the Audio-Technica wing design used in the open-back AD series, but they simply don't sound as good as these headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Ferrell

customer_reviews.title: I hear things in my favorite songs I never heard before.
customer_reviews.text: With a proper DAC/Amp, these headphones will bring out the absolute best in your favorite music, and it's worth every penny. The open-back design makes it perfect for gaming and movies too, along with the super-comfy velour pads. If you want something closed-back or more oriented towards EDM music, try the Audio Technica ATH-M50X instead. These headphones are extremely neutral, when it comes to frequency response. As close to studio quality you can get for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Abraham K.

customer_reviews.title: Studio quality mixing
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these headphones looking for a crystal clear, flat sound for post-production audio mixing. I do just about everything from acoustic signer-songwriter, to metal, to video-post and I love these headphones so far. It takes a bit to get used to not having the "proximity effect" with closed back headphones. It's more like having high-quality speakers in an acoustically accurate room. A note about the "attributes stars"... these are OPEN back headphones, so you will hear other noises in the room, and others can hear when you're listening to music. There are many benefits to open-backed headphones for engineers, but if you're looking for something that isolates, avoid open back!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Butler

customer_reviews.title: Great for high end frequencies, low end.... not so much.
customer_reviews.text: They are huge! Much bigger than I expected. But yeah I make beats and I was looking for mixing and mastering headphones and found these. PROs comfortable Natural Well equipped Flexible Sound quality Perfect for mastering melodies or vocals Comes with nice and soft carrying bag CONS Not really for mastering or mixing low end,s, such as bass, or 808. You can barely hear the bass with these. Also you might need an amplifier as it doesnt really get too loud.
customer_reviews.author: Elijah adams

customer_reviews.title: Some of the best sound I've ever heard
customer_reviews.text: Some of the best sound I've ever heard. Puts my high end car system to shame when it comes to the sheer clarity and detail of sound. I never knew vocals and instruments could sound so life-like! I do wish the bass had just a bit more punch to it for electronic music. But, for acoustic, it's perfect! Also, for FPS gaming (like overwatch) the sound positioning is amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew F Wells

customer_reviews.title: A classic
customer_reviews.text: Very detailed and truly a classic. Bass is a little weak but the rest of the audio range is excellent. If you can live with the reduce bass response, it's a great deal for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas S

customer_reviews.title: Pro sound at a consumer price point.
customer_reviews.text: Very good sound and quite comfortable for us with large heads. Sound is very good and not hyped, especially in the low end. My only wish is that it also came with a coiled cord.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So uncomfortable...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent sound quality. I just can’t understand how they can make such uncomfortable headphones. I’ve had other AKG headphones before and I could wear them for hours on end if I ever wished to. Now I have to keep moving these around every 15 minures for fear it’ll quite literally leave a dent on my skull.
customer_reviews.author: Musings

customer_reviews.title: Best FPS gaming headset for footstep sounds
customer_reviews.text: This headset is hands down the best headset for FPS gaming if you want to make out footstep sounds with pinpoint accuracy. I don’t even want to give this review because it’s like a secret weapon but it deserves to get the credit.
customer_reviews.author: Rene A.

customer_reviews.title: AKG 702
customer_reviews.text: I have highly modded Grado SR60i's, Senn HD558 and HiFiman HE400's. These are by far the best of the bunch. Yes better than the HE400's which are darker (not necessarily a bad thing). The soundstage is incredible and the bass is all there. My current reference.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne

customer_reviews.title: Great improvement over my previous K702's
customer_reviews.text: Great improvement over my previous K702's. It's not just the added bass, the entire sound spectrum feels more detailed. I ran the comparison with both a FiiO E9 on a Soundblaster X-Fi and a Schiit Magni/Modi 2 Über combo (with optical out from the X-Fi), and in both scenarios the K712 showed noticeable improvements over the K702. I didn't have issues with the K702 headband, but this new bump-less one feels even better.
customer_reviews.author: Gonzalo Rubio

customer_reviews.title: Personally the best choice below $300
customer_reviews.text: At this price (usually discounted), AKG k712 pro is awesome as for sound quality and comfort. I have zero complaint. I priotize soundstage and balance of sound over other characteristics, so I was left with k712, HD800s (far too expensive) and the Hifimans. I'm glad choosing k712 as my first equipment entering the Hi-Fi world.
customer_reviews.author: Falsita Fawcett

customer_reviews.title: Right headphone busted after only 4 months
customer_reviews.text: Use these headphones for gaming purposes more so than music and they are better than any other headphones I have used. However, I have only had these 4 months and already having some issues. My right headphone has been going in and out for the last few days and tonight it finally went out and I cant get the sound to play through anymore. Don't know if this is a common thing or I just got bad luck with it. Aside from this issue, great headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Clean sound
customer_reviews.text: I have old ears so these headphones were at the top end of what I wanted to spend. I had an aging Sennheiser HD280 and wanted to try something new. I am not disappointed. So far, I have just used an iMac with a fiio headphone amp (to add some headroom). These headphones have unmuddied clean bass and what I would call level frequency response. They work great for pop, rock, and classical. If they improve with breakin as some other reviewers have stated, so much the better, but overall I am very pleased with the sound out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Lanier

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are absolutely as expected, great sound, comfortable and very light. Aka has a winner with these phones. Great seller as well, fast delivery and well packed
customer_reviews.author: roman fedyk

customer_reviews.title: In 8-months, I had these repaired twice
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality is great, but they just don't hold up. The sound has shorted out twice (needed repair) in the first 8-months that I have owned these.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce K.

customer_reviews.title: Supremely comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Where this headphones is head over heels better than headphones like Beats or Audiotechnica ATX-50 is the comfort. Seriously I can barely feel the pads on my head. I could wear this for hours and not have a problem. If I wore Beats for 30 minutes my ears would start to get irritated. But not these. 10/10 comfort. Wearing these headphones is like a whole new world. Sound quality is A+ as well but I'm not an audiophile so I can't speak much to this.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Great for mixing
customer_reviews.text: very nice for mixing music. also good for gaming. clear, correct audio. wide sound stage. very very comfortable. overall will recommend for anyone who needs headphones for mixing. will not replace proper monitors, but if you cannot afford them or are in a college dorm or something, these are the next best thing you can get. 5/5 stars
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best headphones I've owned
customer_reviews.text: Best headphones I've owned. These little (actually big) guys are acurate, crisp and insanely detailed, on par with Yamaha HS7 studio monitors, they do lack the sub-bass definition of full blown near field monitors but their mid-range and highs are just as good. Also, I have big ears and while all my other headphones will hurt them these will wrap around them and cause me no hassle. I actually wore them yesterday at a full 8-hour recoding session with clients and at the end of the day my hearing was still fresh and my ears unharmed. I'm not going back to buying cheap headphones ever. :) Great job AKG!
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Acosta

customer_reviews.title: Product came broken. Ridiculous.
customer_reviews.text: I waited over a week for this to come in. I was so excited to use these headphones. I unboxed it and everything seem fine. I plugged in the cable to test the headphone out and the left earbud was out. No sound at all. I can not believe this. How do you charge this absurd amount of money for headphones that don’t work. I suggest any STAY AWAY from this seller. Terrible.
customer_reviews.author: Eugene C.

customer_reviews.title: 3+ Years of Bliss
customer_reviews.text: Owned these for over 3 years now and they've been absolutely amazing the whole time through. They get constant use and I haven't had the slightest issue with them. This has easily been one of the best purchases I've ever made. Just make sure you have an amp or a decent sound card to get some stellar performance out of these. Audiophiles will definitely appreciate the range these headphones can handle.
customer_reviews.author: ManBearPig

customer_reviews.title: Huge improvement over my 8-year old Sony 7506s.
customer_reviews.text: Huge improvement over my 8-year old Sony 7506s. I never thought the improvement between a good $100 headphone and the $350 AKGs would be huge. Sony 7506 has all the details that can be heard from AKGs, but the way the AKGs deliver those details are FAR more enjoyable. Bass is slightly stronger on the AKGs (due to 3 db boost), but the soundstage, clarity and the "lifelike" sound of the AKGs is definitely worth more than 3 times the price of the Sony 7506s. The velour memory pads are also very comfortable and it doesn't get my ears sweaty unlike the 7506s.
customer_reviews.author: MyProfile

customer_reviews.title: Very balanced sound. Excellent headphones.
customer_reviews.text: Looks good. Fit is very comfortable. Mids and highs are exquisite excellent source material actually sparkles with life. Bass is there and very balanced, but not excessive. If you're accustomed to Beats you may think it's a bit thin, but it's, again, actually very balanced. Haven't really noticed any fatigue yet. For a wide range of listening these cans will not disappoint. Did I say very balanced? They are very revealing however, so consider your source material. I highly recommend these phones.
customer_reviews.author: HES2

customer_reviews.title: Best headphones I’ve ever used.
customer_reviews.text: So far they are amazing, using them for home studio mixing and mastering. Has helped ease the trial and error of making a good mix on multiple sound systems.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Among the best of all the headphones I own, I like the sound
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding sound, decent fit, Only thing that could be better is if the tension on the auto adjustment cables could be a little stronger, the headphones tend to move down with movement
customer_reviews.author: Identity not given

customer_reviews.title: Shorted Out. No sound Right Ear.
customer_reviews.text: Didn't like that I used the headphones and they shorted out after 7 uses. Unfortunately, had surgery and moved so missed the return date. Was using other headphones for tracking (several pairs same interface for months no issues) until today. Have to call AKG and hope they have a warranty and honor it. Good sound quality, frequency response and stereo spread for final mixing, if they worked.
customer_reviews.author: Boston BCPRS

customer_reviews.title: Love love love these...
customer_reviews.text: These headphones hit all my requirements to a T and then some. 1. Accurate frequency response and clear stereo imaging. 2. Lightweight yet well-built and comfortable. 3. Open ear for a more natural sound. 4. Bigger cans for my bigger ears, can produce for hours without any discomfort. 5. Pads are easily cleanable and even easier to replace. 6. Comes from a tried, true, and tested brand known for high-end audio.
customer_reviews.author: Jesus C.

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Headphones for Mixing—Way Less Ear Fatigue!
customer_reviews.text: So comfortable and sounds amazing. Gives you a real sense of space when listening which is so hard to achieve with headphones. I use these for mixing whenever I don't have access to my monitors, and it's the closest I've been able to come to being happy with headphone mixes in comparison to ones done on monitors. Also, I have noticed SIGNIFICANT decreases in my ear fatigue when listening for a long time since switching to these headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Stanley the Steamer

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: Open backed design so some sound leak out and into headphones. Very comfortable and light weight, I wear them with glasses for hours. All sounds are very clean, present, and precise. Wish it came with a coiled spiral cable aswell:(
customer_reviews.author: Chach

customer_reviews.title: Colorful sound
customer_reviews.text: Broken in mostly now. "Flavorful" was a term i heard used for these. These are open, but have low end like a semi closed pair of headphones (especially with eq). Not neutral like 600's or HE400's. Not the best bang for the buck, but im happy and will be keepong these.
customer_reviews.author: Publicname... Shiat

customer_reviews.title: the fit wears out
customer_reviews.text: These sound good, although not much bass. The elastic that keeps it a tight fit on your head will wear out after a couple years. Have had mine for a few years and the elastic is just floppy string now so these kind of just sit on my head a little low which is kind of annoying.
customer_reviews.author: stephen schirle

customer_reviews.title: 4/1/2018 Real good price on the 702s
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded from very good AKG 240 to the K702 and the difference is more of the acclaimed AKG detail and accurate reproduction of your recording. I just saw that these are about $40 cheaper than the 701 which makes these a relative no-brainer.
customer_reviews.author: P. T. Waite

customer_reviews.title: Finally, fascinated!
customer_reviews.text: Brought the one $449 sold by Amazon itself. And it worths every dime spent. Give it some time to break in. Had tried many ones, but I love AKG. Really love!!!
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: But the best part of it for me was how flat the ...
customer_reviews.text: These are the smoothest headphones I've worn so far. Even after 3 hours, they were still comfy and not giving me any discomfort. But the best part of it for me was how flat the sound was. It has great sound stage and crystal clear detail. If you really want to hear what's going on in a song, this is a must have. Especially for music producers.
customer_reviews.author: U&K

customer_reviews.title: Give them time and you will love them
customer_reviews.text: I've seen many reviews about these headphones stating that the highs are to high. I have had these headphones for about a month and I use them every day for roughly 6-8 hours a day. The highs have calmed down greatly. The sound is great for me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sounds incredible with a tube amp.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these two years ago. And I loved the sound, but I haven't used them for months (been listening to speakers). I just plugged them into my Little Dot MkIII tube headphone amp, and I can only say Wow! I forgot how amazing these sound. You can't go wrong buying these headphones. Just make sure you have a headphone amp to make them sing. The sound just gets better as they break in and the drivers relax. It took a number of days and some night time break-in for the bass to really sound good.
customer_reviews.author: The tech guy

customer_reviews.title: Great open-backed, critical-reference/listening headphones.
customer_reviews.text: Great open-backed, critical-reference/listening headphones. Comfortable, light and airy, and they sound amazing: a nice flat sound without an overload of lower frequencies. Would definitely buy these again.
customer_reviews.author: Bob McCarroll

customer_reviews.title: top headphone
customer_reviews.text: amazing detail, just buy one, don't think to much about it, because these are great. you will need an amp. I use them with schiit magni2 on high gain.
customer_reviews.author: JV

customer_reviews.title: simply amazing.
customer_reviews.text: Never have owned akg products and the only reason I got these because they were one of 3 in a top comparison test. Every headphone brings something unique to the table in their respective price ranges but these perform excellent on all aspects. Comfort, sound, and quality. Best purchase I have made on headphones. Movies sound freaking phenomenal with these headphones. They will blow your mind!
customer_reviews.author: Shawad

customer_reviews.title: Great Sound Quality for Chamber Music and Choral Music
customer_reviews.text: These are wonderful headphones for listening to chamber and choral music, the clarity of sound is amazing. I would not recommend the AKG 702 for modern music which emphasizes drums and bass. They were designed to produce a neutral sound, which they do, magnificently.
customer_reviews.author: T. Green

customer_reviews.title: Super comfortable and great sound
customer_reviews.text: Usually don't write reviews but I absolutely love these. I wear them hours on end for work. They sound great and are very very comfortable. I would get ear fatigue easily from fully closed headphones and no longer have that issue.
customer_reviews.author: David N

customer_reviews.title: The best headphones I’ve used for gaming, I play PUBG
customer_reviews.text: They’re open back so not much noise cancellation if any. Sound is great, can hear everything while I’m gaming. Bass quality is good. You need an amp to drive these on a PC most likely. Fiio E10k works.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Like having two pillows on your head,oh Yeah and they sound good too 😂
customer_reviews.text: Superp quality, very flat and true sounding, great for long mixing sessions. The most comfortable headphones I've ever Used.
customer_reviews.author: noel guzman

customer_reviews.title: Hear things RIGHT IN THE EARS!
customer_reviews.text: Do you enjoy hearing sounds amplified right next to your ear holes? I do, and so I loved these. Those who prefer not to have sounds coming out of things that are placed right next to their aural cavities should avoid this product.
customer_reviews.author: drew

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: The audio quality of these headphones is incredible when compared to their cost. They have a very flat band response and dramatic clarity and separation. When used with a quality headphone amp and DAC, they provide a very nice listening experience. My only critique would be that the bass response is pretty weak. This is to be expected for reference or flat response phones, but a little more bass would improve the sound of most modern music genres. For classical music, they are excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Wavefunction

product_meta.title: AKG Pro Audio K702 Over-Ear, Open-Back, Flat-Wire, Reference Studio Headphones,Black
product_meta.description: style:K702The K702's are reference, open, over-ear studio headphones for precision listening, mixing and mastering. They combine an extremely accurate response with agility and spaciousness. This is achieved by using revolutionary flat-wire voice coils and a patented Varimotion two-layer diaphragm. A totally open design and a high-performance cable complete these reference headphones. The K702's comfortable, specially shaped 3D-foam ear pads and a genuine-leather headband ensure a perfect fit. They provide a professional mini XLR connector for quick replacement of the cable. The K702s are individually tested and serial-numbered.
feature_bullets: Over-ear design for maximum wearing comfort for long work sessions
Sophisticated open technology for spacious and airy sound without compromise
Patented Varimotion two-layer diaphragm for improved high-frequency range and better performance at low frequencies
Unique flat-wire voice coil for higher sensitivity, better impluse and treble response
Specially shaped 3D-foam ear pads for optimum fit and ease of use

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars2,886 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
